name: Introduction to Art History
description: A survey of the history of art from prehistoric times to the present.

name: Foundations in Drawing
description: An introduction to the fundamental principles and techniques of drawing. Topics covered include line, form, value, composition, and perspective.

name: Foundations in 2D Design
description: An introduction to the fundamental principles and techniques of 2D design. Topics covered include color theory, composition, balance, and experimentation.

name: Foundations in 3D Design
description: An introduction to the fundamental principles and techniques of 3D design. Topics covered include form, space, materials, and fabrication methods.

name: Introduction to Printmaking
description: An overview of printmaking techniques including relief, intaglio, and planographic processes.

name: Introduction to Painting
description: An introduction to the materials, techniques, and concepts of painting. Topics covered include color theory, composition, and various application methods.

name: Introduction to Sculpture
description: An introduction to sculpture techniques and materials. Topics covered include additive and subtractive processes, armature construction, and casting methods.

name: Intermediate Drawing
description: Continued exploration of principles and techniques of drawing including advanced composition and experimentation.

name: Contemporary Art
description: An exploration of current trends and issues in contemporary art practice, theory, and criticism.

name: Intermediate Printmaking
description: Continued exploration of printmaking techniques and processes including combination and experimental forms.

name: Intermediate Painting
description: Continued exploration of painting techniques and concepts including advanced color theory, composition, and experimentation.

name: Intermediate Sculpture
description: Continued exploration of sculpture techniques and materials including larger scale projects and public art.

name: Art in Context
description: An examination of the social, cultural, and political context of art production and reception.

name: Advanced Drawing
description: Development of a personalized approach to drawing with an emphasis on individual artistic vision and experimentation.

name: Advanced Studio Practice
description: Guided development of an independent body of work demonstrating mastery of a variety of materials and techniques.
